page.description: Input deals with how to add new data to an Alpha Anywhere application. Most business applications involve the collection of data, often in different formats. Alpha Anywhere can be used to capture a wide variety of data, listed below. So input methods make more sense for mobile devices, such as GPS capture, while others are generally used for web applications, such as the importing spreadsheet files.

case.title: Text and Numbers
case.description: Alpha can capture text, numbers, and special characters from a keyboard or from a virtual keyboard (like the iPhone keyboard). It is also possible to create customized virtual keyboards to make data entry more efficient.

case.title: Images
case.description: Alpha can generate the code you need to capture images or select and upload images from a web application or a mobile device.

case.title: Data From Files
case.description: Alpha can import data from CSV files, MS Access Files, MS Excel files, and other types of files. You can also write a custom routine to import data from virtually any type of file.

case.title: Documents
case.description: Documents in PDF, TIFF, or any other format can be saved as individual files on a server, in a database, or on the cloud via a web service.

case.title: Audio and Video
case.description: Alpha Anywhere applications can capture audio and video from the client device. Files can be saved on the local device, individually on the server or to a cloud service.

case.title: GPS and Maps
case.description: Geographical information can be captured by accessing the GPS system of the client device. It can also be captured by dragging markers on a map.

case.title: Digital Ink
case.description: You can capture notes and drawing entered on touch screen by a finger or stylus. The imported is stored as a scalable vector graphic, which can be edited.

case.title: Signature Capture
case.description: Signature capture is a digital ink control designed to allow someone to sign their name using a finger or stylus.
